title: Battle of Thomas Cook's blame-shifting bosses leaves us no closer to answers
text:
Office reunions can be an awkward affair. Meeting old colleagues from years back, wondering if you’ve still got anything in common with them...

So imagine having one in the full glare of publicity, under the angry eyes of former employees and in front of a panel of MPs baying for your blood. Or at least, hunting for a soundbite for the 10 o’clock news.

Former Thomas Cook chief executives Manny Fontenla-Novoa and Harriet Green, plus former chief financial officer Bill Scott, can’t have been relishing yesterday’s comeback tour in front of the business select committee.

They have kept their counsel since the tour operator plunged into liquidation in September endangering 9,000 jobs, knowing full...
description: Office reunions can be an awkward affair.
